repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Stanford University. Libraries. Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation:
prefercite.p: [Identification of item] Frank Alfred Golder Papers, M0199, Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: American historian of Russia and the Russian sphere of influence in North America.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Summary: Correspondence, notes, documents and typescripts relating primarily to Russia's presence in North America.

did.unittitle: 1. Emily B. Mitchell to the Chief of the Manuscript Division, Library of Congress. Typed Memo
2. List of Transcripts from Russian Archives obtained for the Library of Congress by F.A. Golder
3. Charles MOon to Dr. F.A. Golder. T.L.S.
1927, June 1Certificate of Compoletion of Prescribed Course of Study in the American Methodist Gimnasium, Real Section, Harbin, China. ( In Russian and Chinese)
1858, Aug. 2Extract of some of the Act of Administration of British Columbia. (In Russian)
Notes in Russian concerning the Hudson's Bay Company.
Notes in Russian concerning the Russian-American Company
Typed Biliography (In Russian) 2 copies pertaining to the exploration of teh Russian Far East
1. Typed notes concerning St. Petersbourg in 1764 and 1765.
2. Address given to the History and Philology Section of the Imperial Academy of Science (1861, Jan. 18)
1. Document relating to Bering's First Expedition with comments by Peter.
